citation.article-title: Identification of the bacterial endosymbionts in leaf galls of Psychotria (Rubiaceae, angiosperms) and proposal of 'Candidatus Burkholderia kirkii' sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of 'Candidatus Burkholderia kirkii' sp. nov.
'Candidatus Burkholderia kirkii' (kir'ki.i. N.L. gen. n. kirkii taken from the specific epithet of the host plant, Psychotria kirkii, which was named after its discoverer Sir John Kirk (1832-1922))
The 16S rDNA retrieved from P. kirkii var. tarambassica (19536779) was chosen as the reference sequence.

The endosymbionts can be described as follows. `Candidatus Burkholderia kirkii' sp. nov. [(Î²-Proteobacteria) ; NC; Gram-negative; rod; NAS (GenBank no. AF475063); oligonucleotide sequence complementary to unique region of 16S rRNA gene 5'-GTCTGCTGAGAGGCGGATGTGCTCGA- 3'; S (P. kirkii, stem apex and leaf galls)].
